Package com.rubynaxela.kyanite.audio

Class SoundStream

java.lang.Object
org.jsfml.internal.SFMLNativeObject
com.rubynaxela.kyanite.core.SFMLNativeObject
org.jsfml.audio.SoundSource
com.rubynaxela.kyanite.audio.SoundSource
org.jsfml.audio.SoundStream
com.rubynaxela.kyanite.audio.SoundStream
Direct Known Subclasses:
Music
public abstract class SoundStream extends SoundStream
Abstract base class for streamed sound sources. Unlike buffered sounds, streamed sounds are not held in memory in their entirety, but only a certain amount of sound chunks. When the currently buffered chunk is done being played, the next chunk is requested from the stream's source. This approach should be preferred for long sounds that do not need to be sought around in often, such as music or procedurally generated sounds.
See Also:
  • SoundStream.Chunk

    • isLoop

      public boolean isLoop()
      Returns whether or not the sound stream playback is looping. If a looping sound stream has finished playing its last audio chunk, it will restart playing from the first chunk as if setPlayingOffset(Time.ZERO) was invoked.
      Specified by:
      isLoop in class SoundStream
      Returns:
      true if it is looping, false if not

    • setLoop

      public void setLoop(boolean loop)
      Enables or disables repeated looping of the sound stream playback. If a looping sound stream has finished playing its last audio chunk, it will restart playing from the first chunk as if setPlayingOffset(Time.ZERO) was invoked.
      Specified by:
      setLoop in class SoundStream
      Parameters:
      loop - true to enable looping, false to disable

    • initialize

      protected void initialize(int channelCount, int sampleRate)
      Defines the audio stream parameters. Before the stream can be played, the implementing class must call this method.
      Specified by:
      initialize in class SoundStream
      Parameters:
      channelCount - the amount of audio channels (e.g. 1 for mono, 2 for stereo)
      sampleRate - the sample rate in samples per second
